thread.title: Police: Ramming attack in West Bank may have been criminal - Arab-Israeli Conflict
thread.title_full: Police: Ramming attack in West Bank may have been criminal - Arab-Israeli Conflict - Jerusalem Post

author: BEN HARTMAN
title: Police: Ramming attack in West Bank may have been criminal - Arab-Israeli Conflict
text:
Signs indicate an incident that left two security personnel wounded Wednesday night may have been a criminal incident and not a terror attack, Judea and Samaria Police said Thursday.
On Wednesday night, a Palestinian motorist attempted to run down a border policeman at the a-Zaim security checkpoint near Ma’aleh Adumim and was shot and moderately wounded. On Thursday, police said “there is growing evidence to indicate it was a criminal incident”, specifically the fact that the driver was in a vehicle with stolen plates and using a fake Israeli ID card.
Police are currently investigating the strong possibility that he may have stolen the car and attempted to run the checkpoint in order to evade arrest.
The incident at a-Zaim came shortly after a stabbing attack on Jabotinsky Street in Petah Tikva , one of the busiest thoroughfares in central Israel that left one Israeli badly wounded.
Police said Thursday that greater tragedy was averted however, when the knife wielded by the Palestinian attacker broke in his hand just as he attacked his victim, preventing him from stabbing anyone else.
Sharon subdistrict police said that the blade wielded by 25-year-old Tamer Yunes Ahmed Varidat snapped off the handle of the knife immediately after he plunged it into a 25-year-old Israeli man just after he got off a bus on Jabotinsky Street, a major thoroughfare in the central Israel city.
In surveillance camera footage of the attack, the terrorist can then be seen pacing along the sidewalk, seemingly looking for another victim even as he is suddenly unarmed. Within moments he was set upon by bystanders, who held him until police arrived.
The incident was one of several attacks across Israel on Wednesday that left wounded almost a dozen Israelis.
